title: 'My struggle for British Gas refund'
text:

Sun, Oct 25, 2015, 06:58 GMT - UK Markets closed 'My struggle for British Gas refund' By Jessica Gorst-Williams | Telegraph – 34 minutes ago +115.00 
A reader has been waiting months for a cheque from his energy supplier 
I phoned British Gas to cancel the remaining portion of my Homecare agreement for my old boiler as I had recently had a new one installed. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) agreed to cancel the remaining part of the agreement and to refund £157. About four months ago it advised that the cheque would reach me in the next couple of days. It still hasn’t arrived. IA (KOSDAQ: 038880.KQ - news ) , Surrey 
You kept badgering British Gas and were either not responded to or given assurances that were not lived up to. 
Only further to my involvement did you actually receive the £157 some four months after it had first been promised. The company offered £30 for goodwill but this did not arrive either despite repeated promises. 
British Gas now says: “Unfortunately Mr A’s refund was delayed by a processing error with his cheque. 
“We have apologised to Mr A and he has now received his refund. As a gesture of goodwill we have sent an additional cheque for £100 for the inconvenience caused.” 
This ex gratia payment came three weeks later.
